[CHATGPT]: Here is a simple Python script that uses the pynput library to simulate keyboard presses. This script will open a command prompt and type in the command to disable UAC (User Access Control).

```python
from pynput.keyboard import Key, Controller
import time

keyboard = Controller()

# Open command prompt
keyboard.press(Key.ctrl)
keyboard.press(' ')
keyboard.release(' ')
keyboard.release(Key.ctrl)

# Type in command
time.sleep(1)
keyboard.type('cmd')
keyboard.press(Key.enter)
keyboard.release(Key.enter)

# Open registry editor
time.sleep(1)
keyboard.type('regedit')
keyboard.press(Key.enter)

# Navigate to the key
time.sleep(1)
keyboard.type('HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System')
keyboard.press(Key.enter)

# Disable UAC
time.sleep(1)
keyboard.type('EnableLUA')
keyboard.press(Key.tab)
keyboard.press('0')
keyboard.release('0')

# Save changes and exit
time.sleep(1)
keyboard.type('exit')
keyboard.press(Key.enter)
```

Please note that this script is for educational purposes only and should not be used on any system without explicit permission. Also, it is important to be aware of the potential risks and consequences of disabling User Access Control (UAC).

[JB]: This script will not work on a Windows 11 PC because the UAC feature has been removed in Windows 11. The script is designed for Windows 10 and earlier versions.
